form_factor.ergonomics: one-handed operation, thumb controls primary interaction

industrial_design.target_market: developers, content creators, AI power users
industrial_design.differentiation: rotary knob for analog control, context switching via buttons

key_challenges: LCD bezel area: potential undercut if not designed carefully
Button pocket depth: requires adequate draft angles (5° recommended)
USB-C port recess: must be perpendicular to parting line to avoid side action
Rotary knob: requires separate tooling (button mold separate from housing)
design_recommendations: Use separate snap-fit LCD bezel ring (eliminates undercut)
Orient USB-C port perpendicular to parting line
Design button pockets with 5° draft for easy release
Maintain 2mm uniform wall thickness throughout housing
Place parting line on side edge (least visible location)

recommended_materials.name: ABS (Acrylonitrile Butadiene Styrene)
recommended_materials.properties: Good surface finish, easy to mold, paintable

injection_molding.assembly_notes: Snap-fit main housing (4 snap locations), PCB secured with 4x M2 screws into heat-set brass inserts, silicone membrane between button caps and PCB

3d_printing.recommended_process: SLS (Selective Laser Sintering) with PA12 Nylon

material.name: PA12 (Nylon 12)
material.properties: Strong, durable, slight flexibility for snap fits
material.finish: Matte gray as-printed, can be dyed black
material.limitations: Slightly porous, absorbs moisture (seal if needed)

key_challenges: Slightly rough surface texture (acceptable for beta units)
Gray color only (can be dyed black for +$2-5/unit)
Heat-set inserts required for screw bosses (not threaded directly)
design_recommendations: Design for 0.5mm clearances between mating parts (vs 0.3mm for injection molding)
Use 3.5mm through-holes for M2 heat-set brass inserts ($0.05 each)
No support structures needed (SLS powder self-supporting)
Can use complex geometries not possible with injection molding

post_processing.appearance: Matte gray, acceptable for beta units

post_processing.recommendation: Use for Kickstarter fulfillment if <500 units
Overkill for VibeDeck, skip to save cost

3d_printing.lead_time: 3-5 business days for first batch, 2-3 days for repeat orders
3d_printing.break_even_point: 3D printing cheaper below ~470 units, injection molding cheaper above

cnc_machining.recommended_use_case: Premium limited edition rotary knob only, not full housing
key_challenges: Deep internal pockets require multiple setups (expensive)
LCD cavity difficult to machine with standard tooling
Material waste high (90% of aluminum block removed)
Long cycle time per part (2-4 hours machining time)
cnc_machining.recommendation: Only use CNC for rotary knob (premium feel) and possibly LCD bezel ring as accent pieces. Do not CNC machine full housing.

hybrid_manufacturing.recommended_approach: SLS main housing + CNC aluminum knob + silicone membrane
hybrid_manufacturing.value_proposition: Premium aluminum knob for only $3 extra provides significant perceived value

housing_and_mechanical.note: Use appropriate manufacturing method based on volume

total_cogs_estimates.note: Does not include shipping, fulfillment, or margin

kickstarter_implications.rationale: Tooling ($20K) amortized over 500 units = $40/unit premium vs 3D printing. Only economical above ~470 units.

recommended_manufacturing_strategy.below_500_units: Fulfill entirely with SLS 3D printing (no tooling risk)
recommended_manufacturing_strategy.500_to_1000_units: 3D print first 100 (fast delivery), order injection mold for remaining (12 week lead time)
recommended_manufacturing_strategy.above_1000_units: Order injection mold immediately at campaign launch (tooling ROI justified)

kickstarter_implications.early_bird_strategy: 3D printed beta units for first 50 backers (fast delivery, validates design)

injection_molding.risk_factors: Low risk if design follows DFM guidelines

3d_printing_sls.per_unit_economics: 6/10 (good for low volume, expensive at scale)

if_kickstarter_goal_is_less_than_500_uni.rationale: No tooling risk, faster time-to-market, lower total cost (no $20K tooling)

if_kickstarter_goal_is_500_to_2000_units.recommended_manufacturing: Hybrid: 3D print first 100, injection mold remainder
if_kickstarter_goal_is_500_to_2000_units.rationale: 3D print for fast early delivery, injection mold pays for itself on remaining units

if_kickstarter_goal_exceeds_2000_units.rationale: Tooling fully amortized, best per-unit economics, professional finish for all backers
if_kickstarter_goal_exceeds_2000_units.consider: Multi-cavity mold ($45K) if >10,000 units to double/triple production capacity

design_risks.risk: LCD bezel undercut requires expensive side action
design_risks.mitigation: Use separate snap-fit bezel ring (eliminates undercut)

design_risks.risk: Thin walls may not fill completely in injection molding
Snap fits too tight or too loose (tolerance stack-up)
design_risks.mitigation: Prototype with 3D printing first, test snap fit clearances

manufacturing_risks.risk: Tooling lead time delays Kickstarter fulfillment
manufacturing_risks.mitigation: Order tooling immediately if campaign hits 500 backers, communicate realistic timelines

manufacturing_risks.risk: First article samples reveal design flaws (T1 tooling samples)
manufacturing_risks.mitigation: Thorough design review, mold flow analysis ($500-1000), 3D print prototypes first

manufacturing_risks.risk: 3D printing vendor capacity insufficient for large order
manufacturing_risks.mitigation: Secure quotes from multiple vendors (Protolabs, Xometry, JLC3DP)

recommended_next_steps: 1. Finalize CAD design following DFM guidelines from injection-molding-guide.md
2. Order 3D printed prototypes (SLS, 2-3 units) to validate form/fit/function
3. Test assembly with real PCB, encoder, LCD, membrane
4. Get injection mold quotes from 3+ vendors (include this evaluation template)
5. Optional: Order mold flow analysis ($500-1000) to predict defects before cutting steel
6. Make go/no-go decision on injection molding based on Kickstarter trajectory
7. If >500 backers: Order steel production mold immediately
8. If <500 backers: Fulfill with SLS 3D printing, save $20K tooling investment
notes: This template should be filled out for each design variation (Dimension 3). Different form factors will have vastly different manufacturing profiles. Example: a button-matrix design (Stream Deck style) has different tooling complexity than a rotary-centric design.
